ci_support_linux_64_python3.10.____cpyth:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.description:
Afterburner is a Python package that provides functionality for analysing and
processing climate model data, in particular, though not exclusively, data
produced by the UK Met Office's Unified Model.
about.summary: Tools and apps for processing numerical climate model data

about.description:
Afterburner is a Python package that provides functionality for analysing and
processing climate model data, in particular, though not exclusively, data
produced by the UK Met Office's Unified Model.
about.summary: Tools and apps for processing numerical climate model data

name: metoffice-afterburner
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "metoffice-afterburner" %}
{% set version = "1.3.4" %}
{% set sha256 = "ed2bf255316587d4cc7dd418a0e035fbe7b142d3d7861f610f6497b94b08a002" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name | replace('-', '_') }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: {{ sha256 }}

build:
  number: 1
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv"
  skip: true  # [win or osx]

requirements:
  host:
    - rsync
    - python
    - pip
    - setuptools
  run:
    - python
    - iris >=2.4
    - pyparsing >=2
    - windspharm
    - setuptools

test:
  imports:
    - afterburner

about:
  home: https://code.metoffice.gov.uk/trac/afterburner
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: LICENSE.TXT
  summary: 'Tools and apps for processing numerical climate model data'
  description: |
    Afterburner is a Python package that provides functionality for analysing and
    processing climate model data, in particular, though not exclusively, data
    produced by the UK Met Office's Unified Model.
extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - mo-tgeddes
    - ehogan
